intro: Aeschynomene fluvialis, commonly known as riverbed aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in wetland environments, such as riverbanks and floodplains. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, delicate leaves that are often opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Aeschynomene fluvialis is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in stabilizing soil in aquatic ecosystems.
